education.name: Cornell University, College of Engineering
details: Bachelor's Degree, Computer Science
Dyson Business Minor for Engineers
College of Engineering Dean's List (Fall 2014, Fall 2016, Spring 2017, Fall 2017, Spring 2018)

experience.title: Senior Software Consultant
details: Working in a client-facing role to design, build, and deploy mission-critical fintech solutions to satisfy complex client requirements.

Built backend services for client’s expansion into margin trading and cryptocurrency loan offerings, encapsulating the business logic and risk management of these workflows into a convenient backend API.

Implemented support for Immediate-Or-Cancel orders in matching engine service to support client’s expansion into new trading offerings. Conducted performance testing to measure performance across benchmark workloads.
Improved quality of crypto market connectors through critical bug fixes and enhancements to API key management.
Improved usability of Broadway’s trading GUI applications with feature enhancements like saved user layout configuration and new configuration options for GUI pricing controls.
Led Python training course for Broadway’s new-hire onboarding program, teaching basics of Python programming and how to develop Python services against Broadway’s distributed platform.

experience.company: Cornell Database Group, Data Vocalization Project
experience.title: Research Assistant
details: Research optimization problem of how to efficiently represent relational data through audio interfaces by applying data mining algorithms to translate data into natural language speech.
Collaborate with Professor Immanuel Trummer to develop a database system funded by a Google Faculty Research Award.

Implemented and refined exhaustive and polynomial time approximation algorithms that translate datasets into speech output. These algorithms minimize speaking time subject to user-defined precision constraints.

experience.title: Teaching Assistant, Database Systems
details: Conducted weekly office hours, create and update problem sets and solutions, and grade problem sets for Database Systems course.
Developed automated grading scripts used by team of 20 teaching assistants to optimize grading processes.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
details: Improved data documentation service and data warehouse reporting as a member of Yelp's Consumer Analytics and Metrics team.

Developed backend infrastructure for collecting, cleaning, and analyzing usage data for Yelp's data warehouse and implemented frontend visualizations to describe and convey information to data warehouse administrators.
Provided insight into how Yelp engineers query the data warehouse, guiding decisions to improve system performance.
Redesigned React user interface for data documentation service in order to improve developer workflow.
Collaborated with engineers from a variety of teams in order to accomplish project goals.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
details: Improved database layer of Toast's core web application by refactoring the way developers write and release changes to data sources, increasing the reliability of deploying database schema migrations in both development and production environments and improving the efficiency of the engineering team.
Presented new development workflow to 40+ member engineering team and developed tooling and documentation to facilitate the transition to the new schema migration process.
